org.fujion.highcharts

Class PlotOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.highcharts.PlotOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter, IClientTransform
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlotArea, PlotBar, PlotBox, PlotBubble, PlotBullet, PlotColumn, PlotErrorBar, PlotGauge, PlotHeatMap, PlotHistogram, PlotLine, PlotPareto, PlotPie, PlotPolygon, PlotPyramid, PlotSankey, PlotScatter, PlotScatter3D, PlotSolidGauge, PlotSpline, PlotStreamGraph, PlotSunburst, PlotTileMap, PlotTreeMap, PlotVariwide, PlotVector, PlotWaterfall, PlotWindbarb, PlotWordCloud, PlotXRange

    public abstract class PlotOptions
extends Options
    Base class for all plot types.

    PlotOptions is a wrapper for config objects for each series type. The config objects for each series can also be overridden for each series item as given in the series array. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

      Boolean allowPointSelect

      Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed.

    • Field Detail

      • type

        @Option(ignore=true)
protected String type
        The text identifier of the plot type.

      • allowPointSelect

        @Option
public Boolean allowPointSelect
        Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices. Defaults to false.

      • animation

        @Option
public final AnimationOptions animation
        Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.

      • animationLimit

        @Option
public Integer animationLimit
        For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

      • boostThreshold

        @Option
public Integer boostThreshold
        Set the point threshold for when a series should enter boost mode. Setting it to e.g. 2000 will cause the series to enter boost mode when there are 2000 or more points in the series. To disable boosting on the series, set the boostThreshold to 0. Setting it to 1 will force boosting. Requires modules/boost.js.

      • className

        @Option
public String className
        A CSS class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

      • color

        @Option
public String color
        The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

      • colorIndex

        @Option
public Integer colorIndex
        Styled mode only. A specific color index to use for the series, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}. Defaults to undefined.

      • colorByPoint

        @Option
public Boolean colorByPoint
        When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point. Defaults to false.

      • colors

        @Option
public List<String> colors
        A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

      • connectEnds

        @Option
public Boolean connectEnds
        Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes. Defaults to true.

      • connectNulls

        @Option
public Boolean connectNulls
        Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Defaults to false.

      • cropThreshold

        @Option
public Double cropThreshold
        When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. . Defaults to 300.

      • cursor

        @Option
public String cursor
        You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked. Defaults to ''.

      • dashStyle

        @Option
public DashStyle dashStyle
        A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
        • Solid
        • ShortDash
        • ShortDot
        • ShortDashDot
        • ShortDashDotDot
        • Dot
        • Dash
        • LongDash
        • DashDot
        • LongDashDot
        • LongDashDotDot
        Defaults to null.

      • dataLabels

        @Option
public final DataLabelOptions dataLabels
        Options for data labels.
        See Also:
        DataLabelOptions

      • description

        @Option
public String description
        Requires the Accessibility module. A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series. Defaults to undefined.

      • enableMouseTracking

        @Option
public Boolean enableMouseTracking
        Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance. Defaults to true.

      • exposeElementToA11y

        @Option
public Boolean exposeElementToA11y
        Requires the Accessibility module. By default, series are exposed to screen readers as regions. By enabling this option, the series element itself will be exposed in the same way as the data points. This is useful if the series is not used as a grouping entity in the chart, but you still want to attach a description to the series. Defaults to undefined.

      • findNearestPointBy

        @Option
public String findNearestPointBy
        Determines whether the series should look for the nearest point in both dimensions or just the x-dimension when hovering the series. Defaults to 'xy' for scatter series and 'x' for most other series. If the data has duplicate x-values, it is recommended to set this to 'xy' to allow hovering over all points. Applies only to series types using nearest neighbor search (not direct hover) for tooltip. Defaults to x.

      • getExtremesFromAll

        @Option
public Boolean getExtremesFromAll
        Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only. Defaults to false.

      • id

        @Option
public String id
        An id for the series. Defaults to null.

      • keys

        @Option
public final List<String> keys
        An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources. Defaults to undefined.

      • label

        @Option
public final PlotLabelOptions label
        Text labels for the plot bands.

      • linecap

        @Option
public String linecap
        The line cap used for line ends and line joins on the graph. Defaults to round.

      • lineWidth

        @Option
public Integer lineWidth
        Pixel with of the graph line. Defaults to 2.

      • linkedTo

        @Option
public String linkedTo
        The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

      • marker

        @Option
public final MarkerOptions marker
        Options for point markers.
        See Also:
        MarkerOptions

      • negativeColor

        @Option
public String negativeColor
        The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold. Defaults to null.

      • pointInterval

        @Option
public Double pointInterval
        If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10. Defaults to 1.

      • pointIntervalUnit

        @Option
public String pointIntervalUnit
        On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to irregular time units, day, month and year. A day is usually the same as 24 hours, but pointIntervalUnit also takes the DST crossover into consideration when dealing with local time. Combine this option with pointInterval to draw weeks, quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc. Please note that this options applies to the series data, not the interval of the axis ticks, which is independent. Defaults to undefined.

      • pointPlacement

        @Option
public String pointPlacement
        Possible values: null, "on", "between". In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart. Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

      • pointStart

        @Option
public Double pointStart
        If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945. Defaults to 0.

      • selected

        @Option
public Boolean selected
        Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series. Defaults to false.

      • shadow

        @Option
public Object shadow
        Boolean value whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Optionally can be a ShadowOptions object. Defaults to true.
        See Also:
        ShadowOptions

      • showCheckbox

        @Option
public Boolean showCheckbox
        If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option. Defaults to false.

      • showInLegend

        @Option
public Boolean showInLegend
        Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to true.

      • skipKeyboardNavigation

        @Option
public Boolean skipKeyboardNavigation
        If set to True, the accessibility module will skip past the points in this series for keyboard navigation. Defaults to undefined.

      • softThreshold

        @Option
public Boolean softThreshold
        When this is true, the series will not cause the Y axis to cross the zero plane (or threshold option) unless the data actually crosses the plane. For example, if softThreshold is false, a series of 0, 1, 2, 3 will make the Y axis show negative values according to the minPadding option. If softThreshold is true, the Y axis starts at 0. Defaults to true.

      • stacking

        @Option
public String stacking
        Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent". Defaults to null.

      • step

        @Option
public AlignHorizontal step
        Whether to apply steps to the line. Possible values are left, center and right. Defaults to undefined.

      • stickyTracking

        @Option
public Boolean stickyTracking
        Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true.

      • threshold

        @Option
public Double threshold
        The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor. Defaults to 0.

      • tooltip

        @Option
public final TooltipOptions tooltip
        A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series.

      • turboThreshold

        @Option
public Integer turboThreshold
        When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Defaults to 1000.

      • visible

        @Option
public Boolean visible
        Set the initial visibility of the series. Defaults to true.

      • zoneAxis

        @Option
public String zoneAxis
        Defines the axis on which the zones are applied. Defaults to y.

      • zones

        @Option
public final List<Zone> zones
        An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option. In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlotOptions

        public PlotOptions()

      • toMap

        public OptionMap toMap()
        If type is not null, place options under a submap indexed by the type id.
        Specified by:
        toMap in interface OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter
        Overrides:
        toMap in class Options
        Returns:
        Option map derived from object instance.
